snippet: The Police Department will soon release a colorless, harmless gas in an airflow study to help it prepare to deal with terrorism.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes that New York City Police Department will release colorless, harmless gas in 5 boroughs and 21 subway stations, in airflow study to help it prepare to deal with terrorism; Brookhaven National Laboratory is leading what it says is largest study ever of how air flows in crowded city.
lead_paragraph: The Police Department will soon release a colorless, harmless gas in an airflow study to help it prepare to deal with terrorism.

headline.seo: Test Gas Attack to Come in Subways, and It’s Not the First
headline.main: Test Gas Attack Is Coming to the Subway, This Time With Fair Notice
headline.print_headline: Test Gas Attack Is Coming to the Subway, This Time With Fair Notice
